climbs.name: X Marks the Spot
climbs.fa: Tim McGivern, gear; Patrick Montague, ropeless

content.description:
Climb the left-trending crack. The grade is approximate. Highball, top rope, or do a hard lead on gear. The FA claim may be wrong, but that is unlikely. It required deep cleaning for gear placements and hand holds in the crack. Gear was placed on lead. Taller folks may find it easier.

Gear: The gear is small TCUs (#2 and smaller to #00) and possible a nut or two if you get creative. These are tricky placements. There is potential groundfall if the lower gear blows, hence the PG-13. The crux is protected if it holds!
content.protection: A pad, spotter, or small gear.

content.description: Start on a left-facing hold directly below the small alcove on VRC. Move up into the alcove, and finish on VRC. There is no gear until you get to the alcove.
content.location: This is the direct start to VRC.

climbs.name: Rise Above the Rainbow (aka Vertical Rainbow Crack)

content.description: Start in the blocky corner, and move into the beautiful, arching finger and hand overlapping crack. Lock and jam your way to a place where you can move into the face above. Staying in the crack after the sidepull is a harder variation.
content.protection: Finger to hand size cams and a couple of long slings.
content.location: This climbs the obvious, arching finger and hand overlap.

content.description:
To the left of X Marks the Spot, find the obvious right-trending crack.

 Stand start on the big holds in the crack and move up to some slopers in the crack. Use the crack from X Marks the Spot when you can and finish with at the same point as X Marks the Spot.
content.protection: Pads or you can set up a TR.
content.location: This ascends the crack to the left of X Marks the Spot.

content.description: Climb the obvious ramp to the left of VRC. I'm sure this has been climbed before, but Georgia sent it today.
content.location: Start in the same spot as VRC. It's obvious.

content.description: Start sitting in the middle of the wall underneath the rainbow crack on a left hand undercling and a right hand crimp. Go straight up past the vertical crack. The top looks harder and will take some cleaning.
content.location: This is underneath the Rainbow Crack.

content.description: This is a shady cliff in the woods near the shore of the pond. It is very close to houses but is on public land. There are a handful of very nice lines to about 25-30 feet including a hand/finger arch with plenty of jams.
